references.paper_title: Private and continual release of statistics
references.reason: This paper provided the first algorithm for continual counting with differential privacy, establishing a benchmark against which the current work is compared.

references.paper_title: Private decayed predicate sums on streams
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of privacy with expiration, which is a key element addressed and generalized in the current work.

references.paper_title: Constant matters: Fine-grained error bound on differentially private continual observation
references.reason: This recent paper also focuses on continual counting and offers a refined analysis, establishing state-of-the-art results in terms of the error bound.

references.paper_title: Almost tight error bounds on differentially private continual counting
references.reason: This work provides tight bounds for continual counting in the standard model without privacy expiration, establishing a comparison for the gradual expiration case.
